**Scheduling Conflicts**: Coordinating the schedules of filmmakers, actors, and other participants to ensure everyone is available at the same time can be difficult.
**Logistics and Transportation**: Ensuring that equipment, film prints, and props arrive at the venue on time and in good condition can be a logistical challenge.
**Technical Issues**: Ensuring that all technical equipment is functioning properly and that there are backup plans in place for any technical failures is crucial.
**Marketing and Promotion**: Attracting an audience and generating interest in the festival can be difficult, especially if the festival is new or the films being shown are not well-known.
**Competition and Competition**: Coordinating with other film festivals and ensuring that the festival stands out from the competition can be challenging.
